Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of large North Ionian black-figured pottery dinos; interior reserved; exterior: white slip (mostly worn); painted decoration consisting of animal frieze (decoration mostly worn, only parts of two grazing goats remaining), to left; undetermined decoration at bottom of sherd. Fresh breaks top and left, perhaps indicating proximity to fragment 393.c.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.393.a-c and e-h
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 784, pl. XXI, no. 784)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 685, no. 435)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1140)
